question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
According to the table below, how many dollars are in the median value of the 59 salaries paid to this company's employees?

\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|}
\hline
\textbf{Position Title}&\textbf{\# with Title}&\textbf{Salary}\\\hline
President&1&$\$130{,}000$\\\hline
Vice-President&5&$\$90{,}000$\\\hline
Director&10&$\$75{,}000$\\\hline
Associate Director&6&$\$50{,}000$\\\hline
Administrative Specialist&37&$\$23{,}000$\\\hline
\end{tabular}
inference:
The median salary is the salary in the middle of the list of salaries when listed in order from least to greatest. To find the median salary, we first need to find the total number of salaries paid. 

$$1+5+10+6+37=59$$

Since there are 59 salaries, the middle salary is the 30th salary. We can find the 30th salary by starting at the bottom of the list and counting up until we get to the 30th salary.

$$\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$23{,}000,\$50{,}000$$

The 30th salary is $23,000. Therefore, the median salary is $23,000.

Final Answer: $\boxed{23000}.$ I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Since more than half the employees are Administrative Specialists, the median salary will be an administrative specialist, thus, $\boxed{\$23{,}000}$.
